record.description: Astronomer Walter Linke at the telescope control board viewed from the McDonald Observatory dome. Both the observatory, in the Davis Mountains of Western Texas, and its 82-inch reflecting telescope, the second largest in the world, were designed and built by the Warner and Swasey Company of Cleveland, Ohio for the University of Texas which will operate the facility with the University of Chicago. The observatory will be dedicated May 5, 1939.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Stamp: University of Chicago Magazine. Copy has stamp: Please return to the University of Chicago Dept. of Press Relations.
